titles.title: To direct the Administrator of General Services to acquire by transfer the Old U.S. Mint in San Francisco, California, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. H. Rept. 103-634.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 346.

action.text: Mr. Traficant moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 548.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 2551 proposed by Senator Gorton for Senator McCain.
Amendment SP 2551 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Traficant moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment.
DEBATE - The House proceeded wtih forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 8/11/1994--Passed Senate amended. Directs the Administrator of General Services to take necessary action to acquire by transfer, without consideration, the "Old U.S. Mint" at Fifth and Mission Streets, San Francisco, California. Declares that nothing in this Act shall be construed to force the General Services Administration to repair the Old U.S. Mint before repairs to other Federal buildings in greater need of repair.
